metadata.title: CVE-2021-47569 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:io_uring: fail cancellation for EXITING tasks WARNING: CPU: 1 PID: 20 atfs/io_uring.c:6269 io_try_cancel_userdata+0x3c5/0x640 fs/io_uring.c:6269CPU: 1 PID: 20 Comm: kworker/1:0 Not tainted 5.16.0-rc1-syzkaller #0Workqueue: events io_fallback_req_func RIP:0010:io_try_cancel_userdata+0x3c5/0x640 fs/io_uring.c:6269 Call Trace:<TASK> io_req_task_link_timeout+0x6b/0x1e0 fs/io_uring.c:6886io_fallback_req_func+0xf9/0x1ae fs/io_uring.c:1334process_one_work+0x9b2/0x1690 kernel/workqueue.c:2298worker_thread+0x658/0x11f0 kernel/workqueue.c:2445 kthread+0x405/0x4f0kernel/kthread.c:327 ret_from_fork+0x1f/0x30 arch/x86/entry/entry_64.S:295</TASK> We need original task's context to do cancellations, so if it'sdying and the callback is executed in a fallback mode, fail thecancellation attempt.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47569` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 6.2.0-20.20
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 6.2.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1003-laptop - 6.5.0-1003.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1003.3

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-oracle - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 6.2.0-1004.5
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 6.2.0-1004.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1002-starfive - 6.5.0-1002.3
No subscription required

linux-aws package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1003.3').

linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-laptop package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1003.6').
linux-lowlatency package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1003.3').
